result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Key is heard on the status. Would like to set for a change of plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:36 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Key is heard on the status of the case. Reached an agreement, one more status.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:45 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Key is heard. 

Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Atty Key is heard and they are prepared for the arraignment. 

Atty Key is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will plead not guilty, clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:08 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Key is heard on the status of the case.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney -  Court appoints Attorney Daniel Key

10:28 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

10: 32 AM  -case recalled  (Def. prior connection was lost)

Court reviews Def.'s petition for court appointed attorney 

Court finds def. does not qualify for public defender, but is unable to retain a private attorney, entitled to court appointed attorney.

Court grants petition for Court appointed attorney.  Def. to make payments of $300.00 per month com. 7/13/222  by wage assignment  (Driftless Organics)

questions by def. re: treatment court eligibility - response by Court
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
2:29 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin Joseph Fassbinder in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

Defendant is heard on retaining an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:03 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Benjamin J Fassbinder in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State request this case be adjourned to sometime next week
Court will grant one continuance, if no complaint at next appearance def. will be released from bond.
Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:17 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin J Fassbinder appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
